content.question:
Listen to the excerpt.

An arpeggiated 64 chord is featured in the progression above. The version that you hear has which of the following voice-leading errors?

choices.label: The third of the 64 chord is missing.
The fifth of the 64 chord is not doubled in the soprano.
The 64 chord is not preceded by another position of the same chord.
The 64 chord is not followed by another position of the same chord.

content.answer: The 64 chord is not preceded by another position of the same chord.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Apply knowledge of musical symbols and terms to detect discrepancies in pitch and rhythm when comparing notated and performed music in one or two voices.
